page.title: 03CONNEL BRIDGE,CONNEL
page.content: This bridge was built during the years 1900 and 1903, when Queen Victoria was reigning.She died before completion of it.It is a cantilever type and is made of metal.Cecil Booth,the engineer who supervised the work,later became known as the inventor of the vacuum cleaner. It used to be a road and railway bridge,but in 1966 when the trains no longer travelled from Oban to Ballachulish,the rails were lifted and it became a road bridge.It is single track and traffic is controlled by lights.They are now automatically controlled.The maximum height for vehicles crossing is 13".All boats which sail down Loch Etive have to be small enough to pass under the bridge. Every five years the bridge is painted and repaired.
